member.summary: Base class for any validator.

member.name: T:ComLib.IValidator
member.summary: Interface for a validator that supports both stateful and non-stateful validation.

member.name: T:ComLib.IValidatorStateful
member.summary: Interface for a class that can serve as a validator. This interface is stateful which means it stores the last validation result, the object being validated.

member.name: M:ComLib.IValidatorStateful.Validate
member.summary: Performs validation on data provided during initialization/construction.

member.name: M:ComLib.IValidatorStateful.Validate(ComLib.IValidationResults)
member.summary: Validate using the results collection provided.

member.name: P:ComLib.IValidatorStateful.Target
member.summary: The object to validate.

member.name: P:ComLib.IValidatorStateful.Message
member.summary: Message to use for a validation failure.

member.name: P:ComLib.IValidatorStateful.IsValid
member.summary: method to determine if validation has passed or failed for the object(s) being validated.

member.name: P:ComLib.IValidatorStateful.Results
member.summary: The last validation results.

member.name: T:ComLib.IValidatorNonStateful
member.summary: Interface for a validator that does not store any stateful instance data. This allows for the entire validation to be done in one method.

member.name: M:ComLib.IValidatorNonStateful.ValidateTarget(System.Object)
member.summary: Validates and returns a new with all the entries that represent the validation failures.
member.returns: The results of the validation.

member.name: M:ComLib.IValidatorNonStateful.Validate(System.Object,ComLib.IValidationResults)
member.summary: Validates and adds entires representing failures to the supplied .
member.param: The where the validation failures should be collected.

member.name: M:ComLib.IValidatorNonStateful.Validate(ComLib.ValidationEvent)
member.summary: Validate using the supplied validation event that encapsulates both the target and results.

member.name: M:ComLib.ValidationSupport.ValidatorBase.Validate
member.summary: Validate data using data provided during initialization/construction.

member.name: M:ComLib.ValidationSupport.ValidatorBase.ValidateTarget(System.Object)
member.summary: Validate using the object provided.

member.name: M:ComLib.ValidationSupport.ValidatorBase.Validate(ComLib.IValidationResults)
member.summary: Validate using the results collection provided.

member.name: M:ComLib.ValidationSupport.ValidatorBase.Validate(System.Object,ComLib.IValidationResults)
member.summary: Validate using the object provided, and add errors to the results list provided.

member.name: M:ComLib.ValidationSupport.ValidatorBase.Validate(ComLib.ValidationEvent)
member.summary: This Method will call the ValidateInternal method of this validator.
member.remarks: The reason that the ValidateInternal method is NOT called directly by the other Validate methods is because the CodeGenerator generates the Validation code inside of the ValidateInternal method. If a client wants to override the validation while sill leveraging the autogenerated validation code, it can be done by overrideing this method and calling the ValidateInternal method. This allows a lot of flexibility for codegeneration.

member.name: M:ComLib.ValidationSupport.ValidatorBase.ValidateInternal(ComLib.ValidationEvent)
member.summary: Implement this method.

member.summary: Add a new result to the list of errors.

member.summary: The object to validate.

member.name: P:ComLib.ValidationSupport.ValidatorBase.Message
member.summary: Message to use for the description of an error.

member.name: P:ComLib.ValidationSupport.ValidatorBase.IsValid
member.summary: Simple true/false to indicate if validation passed.

member.name: P:ComLib.ValidationSupport.ValidatorBase.Results
member.summary: The results of the last validation.

member.name: T:ComLib.Types.TimeHelper
member.summary:
Class to parse time in following formats.
1. 1 2. 1am 3. 1pm 4. 1:30 5. 1:30am 6. 12pm

member.name: M:ComLib.Types.TimeHelper.ParseStartEndTimes(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary:
Parses the start and (optional) end time supplied as a single string.
e.g. 11:30am 11am - 1pm 11am to 1pm
member.remarks: If only 1 time is provided, it's assumed to be the starttime, and the end time is set to TimeSpan.MaxValue

member.name: M:ComLib.Types.TimeHelper.ParseStartEndTimes(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Parses the start and end time and confirms if the end time is greater than the start time. e.g. 11am, 1:30pm

member.name: T:ComLib.LocationSupport.LocationLookUpWithCountry`1
member.summary:
Class to provide fast lookup for location components (cities and states) that have a country id. The base class provides lookup by 1. id. 2. name. 3. name and countryid.
This class extends the lookup by also being able to lookup a city by country id.
member.remarks: Instead of storing another set of indexes for cityname, countryId This only stores the cityname, countryId for duplicate city names.

member.summary: Interface for any calculator to process the page action.

member.summary: Calculate pages

member.name: T:ComLib.Paging.PagerCalculatorDefault
member.summary:
Default implementation of a pager. This uses a calculation scheme where the rules are the following :
1. All possible links include ( first, previous, page1, page2, pageX, next, last ) 2. The number of pages in the middle ( page1, page2 ) can be configured. 3. If current page = 1 ( links first and previous are not applicable ) 4. If current page = last ( links last and next are not applicable ) 5. The number of pages in the middle is cycled.

member.name: M:ComLib.Paging.PagerCalculatorDefault.GetTotalRanges(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the total number of ranges.

member.name: M:ComLib.Paging.PagerCalculatorDefault.GetRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Get the total ranges. e.g. Total pages = 18
1 - 5 = Range 1 6 - 10 = Range 2 11 - 15 = Range 3 14 - 18 = Range 4
member.param: Number of pages to display in the middle. This does not include the first page link and last page link.

This class extends the lookup by also being able to lookup a city by country id.
member.remarks: Instead of storing another set of indexes for cityname, countryId This only stores the cityname, countryId for duplicate city names.

Url helper to provide various utitlity methods.

2. Get url's that have been rewritten.

member.summary: Initialize.

member.name: M:ComLib.Samples.Example_ActiveRecord.Init(System.Object)
member.summary:
Configure the ActiveRecord for Accounts NOTES: - All service objects can be constructed with a repository, validator, settings object. - All service objects can be constructed with a fake repository ( in memory ) for testing.
POSSIBLE CONFIGURATIONS: 1. Singleton account service as is. 2. Singleton account service and enable repository connection configuration. 3. Factory method for creating account service and enable repository connection configuration. 4. Factory methods for creating service, repository, validator and enabling repository connection configuration.

member.name: M:ComLib.LocationSupport.LocationService.Parse(System.String)
member.summary:
Does a high-level check of the format supplied and determines what type of location input was supplied.
Formats are: 1. city - "Bronx" 2. city,state - "Bronx , New York" 3. city,state( abbreviation ) - "Bronx , NY" 4. city,country - "HomeTown , USA" 5. state - "New Jersey" 6. state abbreviation - "NJ" 7. country - "Italy" the actuall parsing

member.name: M:ComLib.LocationSupport.LocationService.MapPossibleAlias(System.String)
member.summary: Get the possible formal name associated with the alias / abbreviation entered. e.g. USA -> United States

member.name: M:ComLib.LocationSupport.LocationService.InternalParse(System.String)
member.summary:
Does a high-level check of the format supplied and determines what type of location input was supplied.
Formats are: 1. city - "Bronx" 2. city,state - "Bronx , New York" 3. city,state( abbreviation ) - "Bronx , NY" 4. city,country - "HomeTown , USA" 5. state - "New Jersey" 6. state abbreviation - "NJ" 7. country - "Italy" the actuall parsing
member.param: The location to parse. Can be any combination of inputs, check the summary above.

member.summary: Checks whether the location text supplied is empty. This trims any white space from both sides of the text before checking for empty string.

member.summary: Determines if the location text supplied is a U.S. zipcode. This is true if text is 5 characters that are all numbers.
